sub_title: AI Researcher | Data Science | Machine Learning | IoT and Smart Home | Earthquake Forecasting | Published Author
summary:
Experienced geophysicist and AI researcher passionate about leveraging technology to address complex challenges in geosciences. I have a track record of impactful research with multiple high-impact journal publications and a strong background in seismic modeling. With a deep expertise in developing advanced AI algorithms, I'm dedicated to driving innovation and achieving significant results. Let's connect and explore opportunities to collaborate on cutting-edge advancements in AI-driven solutions for seismic modeling and beyond.

Key Areas of Expertise:

AI and Machine Learning: Proficient in developing advanced AI algorithms for IoT and smart home applications, with a focus on heating optimization and occupancy prediction.
Data Science: Skilled in utilizing data to drive insights and decision-making, from earthquake forecasting to smart home management.
Geospatial Modeling: Proficiency in geospatial analysis, modeling, and mapping, enabling me to extract valuable insights from geospatial data.
Publication: Authored impactful research papers in high-impact journals, contributing to the advancement of geoscience knowledge.
Leadership: Led critical projects, driving innovation and achieving significant results in diverse roles, including academia and industry.
I'm particularly proud of my contributions, such as enhancing earthquake forecasting accuracy by 20-fold through custom Kernel Density Estimator implementation. In my current role at Open Universiteit, I'm developing innovative AI solutions for room-level occupancy detection and smart home digital twins.

My passion for technology and data-driven solutions drives me to seek opportunities where I can make a meaningful impact. Let's connect and explore how my skills and expertise can benefit your organization.

profile_positions.description:
I'm currently serving as an AI Researcher at Open Universiteit, where I specialize in data analysis for smart home management. My role revolves around harnessing the power of machine learning and data-driven solutions to optimize heating systems and predict room-level occupancy. Some key aspects of my responsibilities include:

Smart Home Data Analysis: Leveraging advanced data analytics techniques to gain insights into smart home management, particularly focusing on heating optimization.
Machine Learning Expertise: Applying machine learning algorithms to develop predictive models for room-level occupancy detection.
Innovation and Research: Actively involved in cutting-edge research to improve smart home technologies and enhance user experiences.
Cross-functional Collaboration: Collaborating with multidisciplinary teams to integrate AI solutions seamlessly into smart home systems.
Publication: Continuously contributing to research papers and publications in the field of AI and smart home management.

My work at Open Universiteit has allowed me to combine my passion for technology with my expertise in AI and data analysis, driving innovation in the field of smart home management.
profile_positions.title: AI Researcher | Computer Science | Smart Home Data Analyst | Machine Learning Specialist

profile_positions.description:
During my tenure as an AI Developer at Temblor, Inc., I had the privilege of leading a critical project known as the Global Earthquake Activity Rate (TGEAR) model. This endeavor played a pivotal role in generating stochastic earthquake events and assessing the probability of earthquakes exceeding specific magnitudes. Here are some key highlights of my contributions:

Global Earthquake Activity Rate (TGEAR) Model: Led a two-year effort on the Global Earthquake Activity Rate (TGEAR) model, instrumental in generating stochastic earthquake events and assessing the probability of earthquakes exceeding specific magnitudes. Applications extended to the catastrophe bond, reinsurance, and risk financing industries.
Integration of Hazard Tools: Successfully integrated established Temblor's hazard and fragility tools into a third party risk financing platform, enhancing the effectiveness of earthquake risk financing strategies for insurers, reinsurers, and risk financing institutions.
Catastrophe Bond and Reinsurance Integration: Played a pivotal role in integrating the TGEAR model into catastrophe bond and reinsurance industry practices, providing insurers and reinsurers with improved earthquake risk assessments. This led to enhanced preparedness, reduced risks, and significant savings in terms of both lives and economic losses.
Data Enhancement: Mined and incorporated ten times more data into the ground-motion model, enhancing the accuracy and reliability of earthquake risk assessments for the insurance and reinsurance sectors.
Event Set API: Co-developed an event set API that streamlined data access and analysis for catastrophe bond issuers and reinsurers. This resulted in remarkable success in sales during its first quarter.

My work at Temblor, Inc. not only involved technical skills but also required strategic thinking and leadership abilities to drive innovation in earthquake forecasting.
profile_positions.title: Software Developer | Earthquake Forecasting Specialist | Data Science Innovator

profile_positions.description:
During my tenure as a Part-time Lecturer at Boğaziçi University, I had the privilege of teaching the graduate-level course on Plate Tectonics and Crustal Deformation. This 14-week course delved into critical aspects of geoscience and provided students with a solid foundation in these subjects. Some key highlights of my role include:

Course Development: Contributed to the development of course materials, ensuring that the content remained relevant and up-to-date.
Effective Instruction: Employed interactive teaching methods to engage students, facilitate discussions, and promote a deeper understanding of the subject matter. Transferred most of the lab sessions into Jupyter notebooks.
Mentoring: Provided guidance and support to students, fostering their growth and interest in geoscience.
Subject Mastery: Demonstrated expertise in plate tectonics and crustal deformation, which enriched the learning experience for students.
My experience as a part-time lecturer allowed me to share my passion for geoscience and contribute to the education and development of future professionals in the field.
profile_positions.title: Geoscience Lecturer | Plate Tectonics and Crustal Deformation Specialist

profile_positions.description:
During my tenure as a Postdoctoral Researcher at Boğaziçi University, I embarked on a research journey that focused on continental rheology and deformation. This endeavor involved the construction of a new thermal model using probabilistic (Bayesian) inversion, computer-aided tomography, and spectral analysis of satellite magnetic data. Here are some key highlights of my contributions:

Research Grant Acquisition: Successfully acquired a $14,000 grant to fund my research project, demonstrating my ability to secure external funding for scientific endeavors.
Published Research: Authored two impactful research papers in Tectonophysics, both focusing on intra-slab deformation, with both papers receiving substantial citations and recognition in the scientific community.
Referee for Prestigious Journal: Served as a referee for one of Nature's journals, contributing to the peer-review process and showcasing my expertise in the field.
Scientific Session Convenor: Convened a scientific session at the European Geosciences Union General Assembly for two consecutive years, ranking 2nd in the total number of contributions and attendance in the relevant division of the meeting.
My experience as a postdoctoral researcher allowed me to dive deep into geophysical research, secure funding, and contribute to the scientific community through impactful publications and collaborations.
profile_positions.title: Geophysical Researcher | Bayesian Modeling Specialist | Published Author

profile_positions.description:
During my tenure as the Head of Education Department at TEMA Vakfı, I played a pivotal role in overseeing and managing education initiatives aimed at fostering environmental awareness. I successfully managed an annual budget of approximately $500,000, which encompassed various aspects of our initiatives, including:

Team Leadership: Managed a multidisciplinary team of 5 key experts, fostering a collaborative and efficient work environment.
E-Learning Platform Development: Spearheaded the development and implementation of an e-Learning platform for nature education programs, significantly reducing costs associated with content creation, review, publishing, and transportation.
Citizen-Science Mobile App: Pioneered the design and launch of a citizen-science mobile application focused on woody plant identification, engaging citizens in scientific research and promoting environmental awareness.
EU Project Success: Strengthened the logical framework of two EU-funded projects, securing €177,000. The success of these projects was attributed to strategic planning, collaboration with stakeholders, and effective communication of project vision and goals.
My experience as the Head of Education Department not only involved managing a substantial budget but also included leadership, project management, and strategic planning, all of which were crucial in driving initiatives that positively impacted environmental education and awareness.
profile_positions.title: Education Department Leader | Project Manager | Multidisciplinary Team Manager

profile_positions.location: Boğaziçi University Kandilli Observatory and Earthquake Research Institute
profile_positions.description:
During my tenure as an Expert Engineer & Researcher at Boğaziçi University, I was actively involved in a multi-stakeholder project partnership that aimed to enhance the processing of GPS station data for improved spatial sampling. My role encompassed various aspects:

Project Leadership: Brokered a multi-stakeholder project partnership, increasing the number of processed GPS stations by 20% and improving spatial sampling by 10% using k-means and hierarchical agglomerative clustering.
Geospatial Analysis: Applied geospatial analysis techniques to process and analyze GPS data, contributing to the success of the project.
Data Management: Effectively managed and processed large datasets to extract valuable insights for improved spatial sampling.
Collaboration: Worked closely with project partners and stakeholders to ensure the project's success and alignment with its objectives.
My experience as an Expert Engineer & Researcher allowed me to apply my geospatial skills and research expertise to a collaborative project, resulting in significant improvements in data processing and spatial sampling.
profile_positions.title: Geospatial Engineer | Research Specialist | Data Analyst

profile_positions.description:
During my tenure as a Research Assistant at Utrecht University, I played a pivotal role in conducting geological and geophysical research, with a primary focus on modeling within the field of geophysics and geological sciences. Here are some key highlights:

Research Contribution: Actively contributed to various research projects, with an emphasis on geological and geophysical modeling. This included data analysis, numerical modeling, and collaborating with faculty members and research teams.
High-Impact Publications: I am proud to have contributed to the publication of three high-impact research papers in renowned journals. These publications have significantly advanced our understanding of key areas, including slab deformation, earthquake hazard assessment, and regional kinematics.
Teaching Assistance: Provided valuable support as a Teaching Assistant for several courses, including "Lithosphere Dynamics" at the BSc level and "Tectonophysical modeling" at the MSc level. Assisting in course delivery, facilitating discussions, and engaging with students to enhance their learning experience.
Research Documentation: Assisted in the documentation of research findings, modeling methodologies, and data analysis procedures.
My experience as a Research Assistant allowed me to develop and apply a diverse set of skills in research, numerical modeling, teaching, and collaboration, contributing to both the academic and research aspects of the university's mission.
profile_positions.title: Geoscience Research Assistant | Data Analyst | Research Collaborator

profile_positions.description:
During my tenure as a Research Assistant at Istanbul Technical University, I actively contributed to geophysical and geological research projects, applying a diverse range of skills and expertise. Here are some key highlights of my contributions:

Course Development: Developed and delivered the course "Earth System Modelling," where I introduced students to the application of box models and differential equations in environmental disciplines. This course provided students with a deep understanding of modeling techniques used in the Earth sciences.
Thermal Modeling: Developed a semi-analytical thermal model to investigate plateau support mechanisms, contributing to our understanding of geological processes in the region.
Fieldwork: Participated in geological fieldwork activities, including geological mapping, to gather valuable data for research projects and enhance our knowledge of local geological features.
Student Supervision: Supervised students during the Field Geology course, providing guidance and mentorship to help them develop practical skills and gain hands-on experience in geological fieldwork.
My experience as a Research Assistant at Istanbul Technical University allowed me to actively engage in research, teaching, and fieldwork, contributing to advancements in geophysical and geological sciences.
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant
